author: Special Correspondent
text:
There is a significant decline in the number of convictions in corruption cases pursued by the Central Bureau of Investigation in the past three years, according to the Central government.

In a reply to the Lok Sabha, the government said that 3,078 people facing corruption charges were convicted by various courts from 2013 to 2016. A total of 1,136 accused were convicted in 2013. However, there were only 993 convictions in 2014 and 878 in 2015. Till January this year, 71 accused were convicted on graft charges.
title: ‘Convictions down in graft cases pursued by CBI’
